channel.title: [REQ] A decent donation page with username option :O
channel.description:
Hey umm does any1 have a donation page i could borrow which has a username option so i can actually know who donated :S
i would rep ++ and thank :D
PS. I am horrible with html / php :P so i cant create my own :/ but i can edit it nicely i guess :D

item.title: [REQ] A decent donation page with username option :O
item.dc:creator: @CPUsquad CPUsquad
item.description:
@CPUsquad wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:13, topic:458292”][quote author=CPUsquad link=topic=561212.msg4097089#msg4097089 date=1346980259]

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,560157.0.html

its pretty nice but there isnt a login system i need a tempelate w/ a ready full login / register system i would pay maybe if its a nice tempelate or i would trade somethin from my 718 source

I can’t accept payments of any form.

However, you can find login systems all over the net for free which you could implement.

ya ik but its just toooo much work for me cuz i gotta program server stuff and website stuff alone

Do u know a website called FROST BLADES… I LOVE THEIR PAGE i kinda want sumtin like that but i would totally change the sprites around (hate the darkness) but their register system works thru sql and we cant get that db ;/
[/quote]

Mostly positive they used my runescape website release. :rolleyes:
As for a log-in system, as Ruby stated, there are plenty of different scripts all over YouTube and various other sites, just watch them and try to learn some PHP along the way![/quote]

ya ik they used ur runescape website release but that will easily earn them a copy right btw ya ik but im kinda lookin for a ready tempelate with a login system if sum1 can help me and join my team as a web dev i would love it ( i currently own a 718 )

thanks

item.source: [REQ] A decent donation page with username option :O

item.title: [REQ] A decent donation page with username option :O
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Firstly, you’ll want a log-in screen where the user can of course log-in. I can provide that, however, checking if they actually donated requires some set up with Paypals IPN (Instant Payment Notification) resource, which i’m not too well with. Here is a script that provides a box for the user to enter their username, after they have provided a username, it displays the donation button. If you give me more information on what else you want, I’ll be happy to put some more into the script. (This system doesn’t use MySQL, it stores sessions for the time being) as said, if you want to confirm that someone has donated, you’ll have to set up Instant Payment Notification from Paypal, However, I’ll add in a spot where it can perform a query and store information to a database, from the username the user has submitted, You can then view at least who provided a username.

[code]// This is an PHP comment, it does not show to the person viewing the page.

<?php
	//Defines The Username Variable
	@$username = $_SESSION['username'];
	
	//What to do if no username has been inputted
	if(!$username){
		//Tell the user they must enter a username
		echo 'You must enter a username to proceed!';
		//Display Username Field
		echo '<form action="donate.php" method="post>
				<input type="text" name="username" />
					<input type="submit" value="Proceed" />
			</form>
		';
		
		//Else statement if the user is logged in
		} else {
		//Display the donate button
		echo '<a href="#">Donate</a>';
		}
?>

</body>
[/code]

connect.php

<?php

$dbhost = 'HOST';
$dbuser = 'USERNAME';
$dbpass = 'PASSWORD';

$conn = mysql_connect($dbhost, $dbuser, $dbpass) or die('Error connecting to mysql');

$dbname = 'DATABASE';
mysql_select_db($dbname);
?>

Go to http://yourdomain.com/create.php (to execute and perform the actions in this file.)
create.php

[code]<?php
include “connect.php”;

//Creates Database
mysql_query("CREATE DATABASE donations") or die(mysql_error());
//Creates Table
mysql_query("CREATE TABLE donated (username CHAR)") or die(mysql_error());

?>[/code]

Things you’ll need to change:

Line 7: mysql_query(“INSERT INTO table username=’$username’”);
Edit: Replace ‘table’ with your table name.

Line 34: echo '<form action=“donate.php” method="post>
Edit: You’ll need to change the donate.php to something else, if your page name isn’t donate.php

Line 43: echo ‘Donate’;
Edit: Replace # with the donate link, or replace the line with echo ‘PAYPAL BUTTON CODE’;

This should be a function-able script, let me know if something goes wrong.

Read full topic
